onyomiExamples.meaning: step, stair, (flight of) steps, (row of) stitches, columns (of print), grade, rank, level, counter for breaks in written language (or speech, etc.), dan, senior rank in martial arts, go, shogi, etc.
grade, level, stage, class, phase, steps, order, gradation
exceptional, unusual, special, especially, exceptionally, unusually
half-way up a slope or stairway, landing, center of three (horizontal) columns (of print) (centre)

variable measure of fabric (28.8 cm in width), for kimonos: at least 10 m in length, for haori: at least 7.27 m in length, for other clothes: at least 6.06 m in length, 300 tsubo (991.74 meters square, 0.24506 acres), six ken (10.91 m)
fabric, cloth, textiles, drapery, dry-goods, piece goods, measure of kimono material
reduction (of crop size), reduction of acreage (under cultivation)
